result.execSummary:
The defendant James Wayne Lindgren was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to County Jail (<10 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $265.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. If current on existing payment plan fine/costs may be added.

Must provide DNA sample and pay the $200.00 DNA surcharge to the COCC within 60 days or set up payment plan. May be added to payment plan if current.   Defendant may request expungement of the DNA sample under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4) by petitioning the Wisconsin Department of Justice. Expungement of DNA is NOT a court process. 
For information see: http://www.doj.state.wi.us/dles/crime-labs/clb-forms.  Defendant may request expungement of the DNA sample under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4) by petitioning the Wisconsin Department of Justice. Expungement of DNA is NOT a court process.   For information see: http://www.doj.state.wi.us/dles/crime-labs/clb-forms.

Subject to good time and work release. 
**Report date to begin jail sentence extended to 6/1/2016.**
